page.title: 08By pass
page.content: The village of Great Doddington had suffered, like many villages and towns in the area, with a considerable amount of traffic cutting through the village to reach the A45 to Northampton. Recently a new dual-carriageway was built in the Nene Valley considerably decreasing the traffic flow. We completed a twelve-hour traffic survey of the traffic through the village in May and compared it with a similar survey carried out by the school in May 1981. The total number of vehicles counted were: from Earls Barton 1121, a reduction of 47.2%; from Wellingborough 922, a reduction of 56.5%. More significant was the reduction in lorry traffic 67.9% from Earls Barton and 74.3% from Wellingborough.
